summary: A let-statement assigns a value to a local variable.
details: The value will be boxed, if necessary.
The value will be unboxed, if necessary.
The value will be coerced, if necessary.
static-checks: The assignee must be declared somewhere in the enclosing function.
The assignee must be a mutable variable.
The type of the value must be assignable to the type of the assignee.
The type of the value must be either a primitive-type or a reference-type.
example-1: module Main in examples;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    # Declare a new variable.%0A    var planet = %22Venus%22;%0A%0A    # Print the name of the planet.%0A    (F::println planet);%0A%0A    # Change the value of the variable. %0A    let planet = %22Mars%22;%0A%0A    # Print the name of the planet.%0A    (F::println planet);%0A%0A    # Change the value of the variable. %0A    planet = %22Pluto%22;%0A%0A    # Print the name of the planet.%0A    (F::println planet);%0A}
